description: Sustainable IT Dashboard - Private Cloud including suspend actions

options.content:
# Sustainable IT Dashboard - Private Cloud
***
## Summary
This dashboard shows the impact of IBM Turbonomic application resource manager on Energy consumption and Carbon Dioxide equivalents (CO2e) emissions in your private cloud data center environment. 

This dashboard focuses on data collected for physical machines (hosts) through a vCenter API and includes energy consumption data, number of hosts and VMs, VM-to-Host density ratios as well as the number and the type of generated host suspend and provision actions.
***

## Data and Methodology

**Energy (Wh)** - data is collected from vCenter API and summed over a period of 10 minutes to get a single number for total Energy (Wh) in 10 minutes. 

**CO2e emissions (t)** - carbon emissions calculations are made following an open source methodology outlined in Cloud Carbon Footprint website - [www.cloudcarbonfootprint.org](https://www.cloudcarbonfootprint.org/).    
Specifically, in this dashboard carbon emissions are calculated using the following formula:

    Operational Emissions = CO2e (t) = (energy consumption [Wh]) x ((private cloud average PUE) / 1000) x (private cloud emissions factor) x ((100 - percent renewable energy) / 100)

Where:

- ***Private Cloud Power Usage Effectiveness (PUE)*** = An average PUE of 1.67 is used in our calculations. This [451 report](https://d39w7f4ix9f5s9.cloudfront.net/e3/79/42bf75c94c279c67d777f002051f/carbon-reduction-opportunity-of-moving-to-aws.pdf) notes: "Adding it all up, the power usage effectiveness (PUE, the ratio of total datacenter power and the IT power) ranged from 1.63 to 1.70 in the survey sample and was consistent across company sizes. This is in line with broader industry data collected by the Uptime Institute but well below the efficiency of AWS operations." - 451 Research Report. We use the average of 1.63 and 1.70, which is 1.67.

- ***Private Cloud Emissions Factor*** = `1,562.4 lbs CO2/MWh Ã— (4.536 Ã— 10^(-4) metric tons/lb) Ã— 0.001 MWh/kWh = 7.09 Ã— 10^(-4) metric tons CO2/kWh`. We are using `0.000709` (rounded) in our calculations. ***Note:*** Emission equivalents vary slightly vs. EPA calculation because we are using the rounded numbers of the emissions factor (7.09x10^(-4)).

- ***Percent Renewable Energy*** = User can input the percent renewable energy that is used to generate the energy that is used by the datacenter in which physical hosts that are shown in this dashboard reside. CO2e emissions calculations will be adjusted by this input. 

**Density** - this chart shows the number of active VMs per host in your on-prem environment, and tracks the data over the selected dashboard time. 

**Estimated carbon sequestration equivalents** - real world examples of sequestration efforts to remove the total CO2e emissions reported in the *"CO2e Emissions (t) - All Hosts"* chart. ***Note:*** All sequestration equivalents and carbon emissions equivalents are adjusted for percent renewable energy inserted at the top of the dashboard.    
Sequestration formulas are as follow:

- ***Equivalent Carbon Sequestered by Acres of Forest in 1 year (metric tons CO2 / acre)*** = Total Emissions (metric tons CO2) * Acres of Forest Sequestration Factor.    
Where:    
Acres of Forest Sequestration Factor = -0.23 metric ton C/acre/year* Ã— (44 units CO2/12 units C) = -0.84 metric ton CO2/acre/year sequestered annually by one acre of average U.S. forest.

- ***Equivalent Carbon Sequestered by Tree Seedlings Grown for 10 years (metric ton CO2 / tree)*** = Total Emissions (metric tons CO2) * Tree Sequestration Factor.    
Where:    
Tree Sequestration Factor = (-36.4 lbs C/tree Ã— (44 units CO2/12 units C) Ã— 1 metric ton/2,204.6 lbs) = -0.060 metric ton CO2 per urban tree planted.

**Carbon Emissions Equivalents** - To calculate the carbon emission equivalencies we use the formulas provided by United States EPA Greenhouse Gas Equivalencies Calculator [here](https://www.epa.gov/energy/greenhouse-gases-equivalencies-calculator-calculations-and-references). Please note that there will be slight variation between the results you see in the dashboard and what is calculated by the EPAâ€™s site because we are using the numbers they have published, which they have rounded.
- ***Equivalent Passenger Vehicles*** = Total Emissions (metric tons CO2) * Passenger Vehicles Factor (metric tons CO2e/vehicles/year).    
Where:    
Passenger Vehicles Factor (vehicles/year) = 8.89 Ã— (10^-3) metric tons CO2/gallon gasoline Ã— 11,556 VMT car/truck average Ã— 1/22.5 miles per gallon car/truck average Ã— 1 CO2, CH4, and N2O/0.993 CO2 = 4.60 metric tons CO2e/vehicle/year.

- ***Equivalent Home Electricity Use*** - Total Emissions (metric tons CO2) * Home Electricity Use Factor.   
Where:    
Home Electricity Use Facto r= 11,880 kWh per home Ã— 947.2 lbs CO2 per megawatt-hour generated Ã— 1/(1-0.073) MWh delivered/MWh generated Ã— 1 MWh/1,000 kWh Ã— 1 metric ton/2,204.6 lb = 5.505 metric tons CO2/home.

panels.description: How many acres of forest per year will it take to sequester the total CO2e emissions released by physical machines in the selected scope and over the selected time.

targets.rawSql:
SELECT
  m."time" as "time",
  sum(m.current)/1000*${CPU_CONSUMPTION}/${CORES_CPU}*${W_WH_RATIO}*${EFFICIENCY}*24*365 as value
FROM metric m
JOIN entity e on m.entity_oid = e."oid" 
WHERE
  $__timeFilter(m."time") AND
  m.entity_type = 'VIRTUAL_MACHINE' AND
  m.entity_oid IN (${HOST_LIST}) AND
  m.provider_oid is null AND
  m.type = 'VCPU' AND
  m.current>0
GROUP BY m.time
ORDER BY 1

panels.title: Average Energy Consumption (Wh) - All VMs

panels.description: How many acres of forest per year will it take to sequester the total CO2e emissions released by physical machines in the selected scope and over the selected time.

targets.rawSql:
SELECT
  m."time" as "time",
  sum(m.current)/1000*count(e.name)/${CORES_CPU}*${CPU_CONSUMPTION}*${PRIVATE_CLOUD_AVG_PUE}*${PRIVATE_CLOUD_EMISSIONS_FACTOR}/1000/${ACRES_OF_FOREST_SEQUESTRATION_FACTOR}*(100-${PERCENT_RENEWABLE_ENERGY})/100 as value
FROM metric m
JOIN entity e on m.entity_oid = e."oid" 
WHERE
  $__timeFilter(m."time") AND
  m.entity_type = 'VIRTUAL_MACHINE' AND
  m.entity_oid IN (${HOST_LIST}) AND
  m.type = 'VCPU'
GROUP BY time
ORDER BY 1

panels.title: ðŸ¦Œ Total CO2e emissions - Equivalent in acres of forest per year

panels.description: The amount of total CO2e emissions released by physical machines in the selected scope and over the selected time is equivalent to the amount of CO2e emissions released by vehicles driven for 1 year.

targets.rawSql:
SELECT
  m."time" as "time",
  sum(m.current)/1000*count(e.name)/${CORES_CPU}*${CPU_CONSUMPTION}*${PRIVATE_CLOUD_AVG_PUE}*${PRIVATE_CLOUD_EMISSIONS_FACTOR}/1000/${VEHICLE_EMISSIONS_FACTOR}*(100-${PERCENT_RENEWABLE_ENERGY})/100 as value
FROM metric m
JOIN entity e on m.entity_oid = e."oid" 
WHERE
  $__timeFilter(m."time") AND
  m.entity_type = 'VIRTUAL_MACHINE' AND
  m.entity_oid IN (${HOST_LIST}) AND
  m.type = 'VCPU'
GROUP BY time
ORDER BY 1

panels.title: ðŸš— Total CO2e emissions - Vehicles per year

panels.description: How many acres of forest per year will it take to sequester the total CO2e emissions released by physical machines in the selected scope and over the selected time.

targets.rawSql:
SELECT
  m."time" as "time",
  sum(m.current)/1000*${CPU_CONSUMPTION}/${CORES_CPU}*${W_WH_RATIO}*${EFFICIENCY}*${PRIVATE_CLOUD_AVG_PUE}/1000*${PRIVATE_CLOUD_EMISSIONS_FACTOR}*(100-${PERCENT_RENEWABLE_ENERGY})/100*24*365 as "CO2e (t)"
FROM metric m
JOIN entity e on m.entity_oid = e."oid" 
WHERE
  $__timeFilter(m."time") AND
  m.entity_type = 'VIRTUAL_MACHINE' AND
  m.entity_oid IN (${HOST_LIST}) AND
  m.provider_oid is null AND
  m.type = 'VCPU' AND
  m.current>0
GROUP BY m.time
ORDER BY 1

panels.title: Average CO2e Emissions (t/year) - All VMs

panels.description: How many trees growing for 10 years will it take to sequester the total CO2e emissions released by physical machines in the selected scope and over the selected time.

targets.rawSql:
SELECT
  m."time" as "time",
  sum(m.current)/1000*count(e.name)/${CORES_CPU}*${CPU_CONSUMPTION}*${PRIVATE_CLOUD_AVG_PUE}*${PRIVATE_CLOUD_EMISSIONS_FACTOR}/1000/${TREE_SEQUESTRATION_FACTOR}*(100-${PERCENT_RENEWABLE_ENERGY})/100 as value
FROM metric m
JOIN entity e on m.entity_oid = e."oid" 
WHERE
  $__timeFilter(m."time") AND
  m.entity_type = 'VIRTUAL_MACHINE' AND
  m.entity_oid IN (${HOST_LIST}) AND
  m.type = 'VCPU'
GROUP BY time
ORDER BY 1

panels.title: ðŸŒ²Total CO2e emissions - Equivalent in trees growing for 10 years

panels.description: The amount of total CO2e emissions released by physical machines in the selected scope and over the selected time is equivalent to the amount of CO2e emissions released by household electricity consumption for 1 year.

targets.rawSql:
SELECT
  m."time" as "time",
  sum(m.current)/1000*count(e.name)/${CORES_CPU}*${CPU_CONSUMPTION}*${PRIVATE_CLOUD_AVG_PUE}*${PRIVATE_CLOUD_EMISSIONS_FACTOR}/1000/${HOUSEHOLD_EMISSIONS_FACTOR}*(100-${PERCENT_RENEWABLE_ENERGY})/100 as value
FROM metric m
JOIN entity e on m.entity_oid = e."oid" 
WHERE
  $__timeFilter(m."time") AND
  m.entity_type = 'VIRTUAL_MACHINE' AND
  m.entity_oid IN (${HOST_LIST}) AND
  m.type = 'VCPU'
GROUP BY time
ORDER BY 1

panels.title: ðŸ  Total CO2e emissions - Household per year

panels.description: How many acres of forest per year will it take to sequester the total CO2e emissions released by physical machines in the selected scope and over the selected time.

targets.rawSql:
SELECT
  m."time" as "time",
  sum(m.current)/1000*count(e.name)/${CORES_CPU} as value
FROM metric m
JOIN entity e on m.entity_oid = e."oid" 
WHERE
  $__timeFilter(m."time") AND
  m.entity_type = 'VIRTUAL_MACHINE' AND
  m.entity_oid IN (${HOST_LIST}) AND
  m.type = 'VCPU'
GROUP BY time
ORDER BY 1

panels.title: Total CO2e emissions - Equivalent in acres of forest/year

panels.description: How many acres of forest per year will it take to sequester the total CO2e emissions released by physical machines in the selected scope and over the selected time.

targets.rawSql:
SELECT
  m."time" as "time",
  sum(m.current)/1000*${CPU_CONSUMPTION}/${CORES_CPU}*${W_WH_RATIO}*${EFFICIENCY} as value
FROM metric m
JOIN entity e on m.entity_oid = e."oid" 
WHERE
  $__timeFilter(m."time") AND
  m.entity_type = 'VIRTUAL_MACHINE' AND
  m.entity_oid IN (${HOST_LIST}) AND
  m.provider_oid is null AND
  m.type = 'VCPU' AND
  m.current>0
GROUP BY m.time
ORDER BY 1

panels.title: Average Energy Consumption (Wh) - All VMs

panels.description: How many acres of forest per year will it take to sequester the total CO2e emissions released by physical machines in the selected scope and over the selected time.

targets.rawSql:
SELECT
  m."time" as "time",
  sum(m.current)/1000*${CPU_CONSUMPTION}/${CORES_CPU}*${W_WH_RATIO}*${EFFICIENCY}*${PRIVATE_CLOUD_AVG_PUE}/1000*${PRIVATE_CLOUD_EMISSIONS_FACTOR}*(100-${PERCENT_RENEWABLE_ENERGY})/100*1000 as "CO2e (kg)"
FROM metric m
JOIN entity e on m.entity_oid = e."oid" 
WHERE
  $__timeFilter(m."time") AND
  m.entity_type = 'VIRTUAL_MACHINE' AND
  m.entity_oid IN (${HOST_LIST}) AND
  m.provider_oid is null AND
  m.type = 'VCPU' AND
  m.current>0
GROUP BY m.time
ORDER BY 1

panels.title: Average CO2e Emissions per hour - All VMs

panels.description: Total energy consumption in Watt-Hour of all hosts in the selected scope and during the selected time of the dashboard.

targets.rawSql:
SELECT
  m."time" as "time",
  sum(m.current)/1000*${CPU_CONSUMPTION}/${CORES_CPU}*${W_WH_RATIO}*${EFFICIENCY} as value
FROM metric m
JOIN entity e on m.entity_oid = e."oid" 
WHERE
  $__timeFilter(m."time") AND
  m.entity_type = 'VIRTUAL_MACHINE' AND
  m.entity_oid IN (${HOST_LIST}) AND
  m.provider_oid is null AND
  m.type = 'VCPU' AND
  m.current>0
GROUP BY m.time
ORDER BY 1

panels.title: Energy Consumption (Wh) - All VMs

panels.description:
CO2e emissions graph shows the CO2e emissions in metric tons (1 metric ton = 1,000Kg) for the hosts in the selected scope and over the selected period of the dashboard. 
CO2e emissions are calculated using Cloud Carbon Footprint open source methodology. See the Help section for more details.

targets.rawSql:
SELECT
  m."time" as "time",
  sum(m.current)/1000*${CPU_CONSUMPTION}/${CORES_CPU}*${W_WH_RATIO}*${EFFICIENCY}*${PRIVATE_CLOUD_AVG_PUE}/1000*${PRIVATE_CLOUD_EMISSIONS_FACTOR}*(100-${PERCENT_RENEWABLE_ENERGY})/100*1000 as "CO2e (kg)"
FROM metric m
JOIN entity e on m.entity_oid = e."oid" 
WHERE
  $__timeFilter(m."time") AND
  m.entity_type = 'VIRTUAL_MACHINE' AND
  m.entity_oid IN (${HOST_LIST}) AND
  m.provider_oid is null AND
  m.type = 'VCPU' AND
  m.current>0
GROUP BY m.time
ORDER BY 1

panels.title: CO2e Emissions (t) - All VMs

panels.description: This chart shows the number of hosts in your on-prem environment, and tracks the data over the selected period.

targets.rawSql:
SELECT
  e.oid as "Host OID",
  e."name" as "Host Name",
	attrs->>'model' as "Host Model",
	initcap(replace(attrs->>'state', '_', ' ')) as "Power State",
	attrs->>'num_cpus' as "Number of CPU",
	attrs->>'cpu_model' as "CPU Model"
FROM entity e
WHERE
  (e.first_seen, e.last_seen) overlaps ($__timeFrom(), $__timeTo()) AND
  e."type" = 'PHYSICAL_MACHINE' 
ORDER BY 1

select
  e.oid as "Host OID",
  --e.name as "Host Name",
  count(s.seed_oid) as "Current Number of VMs"
from entity e
join scope s on s.seed_oid = e.oid and s.scoped_type = 'VIRTUAL_MACHINE' and s.finish > now()
where
  e.type = 'PHYSICAL_MACHINE' and
  
  e.last_seen > now()
group by e.oid
order by e.name

panels.title: Number of Physical Host(s)

panels.description:
This graph shows the ration of number of active VMs per host over the selected period of the dashboard. 
Active VMs - powered on and discovered by Turbonomic.

targets.rawSql:
SELECT
  m."time" as "time",
  count(m.utilization) as "Number of Active Hosts"
FROM metric m
JOIN entity e on m.entity_oid = e."oid" 
WHERE
  $__timeFilter(time) and
  e.environment = 'ON_PREM' AND
  m.type = 'CPU' 
GROUP BY m.time
ORDER BY 1

SELECT
  m."time" as "time",
  count(m.utilization) as "Number of Active VMs"
FROM metric m
JOIN entity e on m.entity_oid = e."oid"
join scope s on m.entity_oid = s.scoped_oid and s.finish > now() and s.scoped_type = 'VIRTUAL_MACHINE'
WHERE
  $__timeFilter(time) and
  m.entity_type = 'VIRTUAL_MACHINE' AND
  e.environment = 'ON_PREM' AND
  m.type = 'VCPU' AND
  s.seed_oid IN (${HOST_LIST})
GROUP BY m.time
ORDER BY 1

panels.title: VM:Host Density

panels.description:
Estimated average energy per active VMs in the selected scope.
Active - powered on and discovered by Turbonomic.

targets.rawSql:
SELECT
  m."time" as "time",
  SUM(m.current)*${CPU_CONSUMPTION} as "Total Hosts Energy"
FROM metric m
JOIN entity e on m.entity_oid = e."oid" 
WHERE
  $__timeFilter(m."time") AND
  m.entity_type = 'PHYSICAL_MACHINE' AND
  m.type = 'CPU'
GROUP BY m.time
ORDER BY 1

SELECT
  m."time" as "time",
  count(m.utilization) as "Number of Active VMs"
FROM metric m
JOIN entity e on m.entity_oid = e."oid"
join scope s on m.entity_oid = s.scoped_oid and s.finish > now() and s.scoped_type = 'VIRTUAL_MACHINE'
WHERE
  $__timeFilter(time) and
  m.entity_type = 'VIRTUAL_MACHINE' AND
  e.environment = 'ON_PREM' AND
  m.type = 'VCPU' 
GROUP BY m.time
ORDER BY 1

panels.title: Average Energy per VM (Wh)

panels.description:
This chart shows the number of active VMs in your on-prem environment, and tracks the data over the selected period. 
Active VMs - powered on and discovered by Turbonomic.

targets.rawSql:
SELECT
  count(e.name) as "Number of VMs"
FROM entity e
WHERE
  e.type = 'VIRTUAL_MACHINE'

panels.title: Number of Active VM(s)

targets.rawSql:
SELECT
  m."time" as "time",
  m.current/1000*${CPU_CONSUMPTION}/${CORES_CPU}*${EFFICIENCY} as value,
  e.name as metric
FROM metric m
JOIN entity e on m.entity_oid = e."oid" 
WHERE
  $__timeFilter(m."time") AND
  m.entity_type = 'VIRTUAL_MACHINE' AND
  m.entity_oid IN (${HOST_LIST}) AND
  m.provider_oid is null AND
  m.type = 'VCPU' AND
  m.current>0
ORDER BY 1, 3

SELECT
  m."time" as "time",
  m.current/1000*${CPU_CONSUMPTION}/${CORES_CPU}*${W_WH_RATIO}*${EFFICIENCY} as value,
  e.name as metric
FROM metric m
JOIN entity e on m.entity_oid = e."oid" 
WHERE
  $__timeFilter(m."time") AND
  m.entity_type = 'VIRTUAL_MACHINE' AND
  m.entity_oid IN (${HOST_LIST}) AND
  m.provider_oid is null AND
  m.type = 'VCPU' AND
  m.current>0
ORDER BY 1

SELECT
  m."time" as "time",
  (m.current)/1000*${CPU_CONSUMPTION}*${PRIVATE_CLOUD_AVG_PUE}/1000*${PRIVATE_CLOUD_EMISSIONS_FACTOR}*(100-${PERCENT_RENEWABLE_ENERGY})/100 as "MTCO2e",
  e.name as metric
FROM metric m
JOIN entity e on m.entity_oid = e."oid" 
WHERE
  $__timeFilter(m."time") AND
  m.entity_type = 'VIRTUAL_MACHINE' AND
  m.entity_oid IN (${HOST_LIST}) AND
  m.type = 'VCPU' AND
  m.current>0
ORDER BY 1

SELECT
  e.oid as "Host OID",
  e."name" as "Host Name",
	attrs->>'model' as "Host Model",
	initcap(replace(attrs->>'state', '_', ' ')) as "Power State",
	attrs->>'num_cpus' as "Number of CPU",
	attrs->>'cpu_model' as "CPU Model"
FROM entity e
WHERE
  (e.first_seen, e.last_seen) overlaps ($__timeFrom(), $__timeTo()) AND
  e."type" = 'VIRTUAL_MACHINE' AND
  e.oid IN (${HOST_LIST})
ORDER BY 1

select
  e.oid as "Host OID",
  --e.name as "Host Name",
  count(s.seed_oid) as "Current Number of VMs"
from entity e
join scope s on s.seed_oid = e.oid and s.scoped_type = 'VIRTUAL_MACHINE' and s.finish > now()
where
  e.type = 'PHYSICAL_MACHINE' and
  e.oid IN (${HOST_LIST}) and
  e.last_seen > now()
group by e.oid
order by e.name

panels.description:
Estimated average energy savings from all Turbonomic suspend actions. 
Estimated energy savings are calculated based on the average energy over the selected time period for each one of the hosts that have a suspend action attached to them
panels.title: VM Suspend Actions - Estimated Missed Energy and CO2e Savings

panels.description:
List of all Host Suspend actions in the selected scope. 
Average Energy = average energy consumption of the host over the selected period of the report (for example over last 3 hours)
Estimated Yearly Average = the average energy multiplied by the number of hours in a year to get the average annual energy in W-h.

targets.rawSql:
SELECT
  DISTINCT ON (e."name") 
  TO_CHAR(a.recommendation_time, 'dd/mm/yyyy hh:mm:ss') as "Date Recommended",
   e."name" as "Host Name",
  e."oid" as "Host OID",
  a.description as "Description",
  a.target_entity_id as "ID"
FROM pending_action a
JOIN entity e on e.oid = a.target_entity_id
join scope s on s.scoped_oid = e.oid  and s.finish > now()
where
--  $__timeFilter(a.recommendation_time) AND
  a."type" = 'DEACTIVATE'  AND
  e."type" = 'VIRTUAL_MACHINE'  AND
  a.target_entity_id IN (${HOST_LIST})
ORDER BY "Host Name"

SELECT
  e.oid as "Host OID",
  avg(m.current)/1000*${CPU_CONSUMPTION}/${CORES_CPU}*${EFFICIENCY} as "Energy Avg (Wh)",
  (avg(m.current)/1000*${CPU_CONSUMPTION}/${CORES_CPU}*${EFFICIENCY}*365*24) as "Estimated Yearly Energy Avg (Wh)",
  avg(m.current)/1000*${CPU_CONSUMPTION}/${CORES_CPU}*${EFFICIENCY}*${PRIVATE_CLOUD_AVG_PUE}*${PRIVATE_CLOUD_EMISSIONS_FACTOR}*(100-${PERCENT_RENEWABLE_ENERGY})/100 as "CO2e Avg (kg)",
  avg(m.current)/1000*${CPU_CONSUMPTION}/${CORES_CPU}*${EFFICIENCY}*${PRIVATE_CLOUD_AVG_PUE}*${PRIVATE_CLOUD_EMISSIONS_FACTOR}*(100-${PERCENT_RENEWABLE_ENERGY})/100*24*365/1000 as "Estimated Yearly CO2e Avg (t)"
FROM metric m
JOIN entity e on m.entity_oid = e."oid"
JOIN pending_action pa on pa.target_entity_id = e.oid
WHERE
--  $__timeFilter(m."time") AND
  m.entity_type = 'VIRTUAL_MACHINE' AND
  m.entity_oid IN (${HOST_LIST}) AND
  m.type = 'VCPU'
GROUP BY e.oid
ORDER BY 1

panels.title: VM Suspend Actions

list.definition:
select distinct
    name AS __text,
    oid AS __value
from entity
where
    type = 'DATACENTER'
    and attrs->>'targets' like '%vCenter%'
    and last_seen > now()
order by 1
list.label: Data Center
list.name: DATACENTER
list.query:
select distinct
    name AS __text,
    oid AS __value
from entity
where
    type = 'DATACENTER'
    and attrs->>'targets' like '%vCenter%'
    and last_seen > now()
order by 1

list.definition:
select distinct
    e.name AS __text,
    e.oid AS __value
from "scope" s 
join entity e on s.scoped_oid = e."oid"
where
    s.scoped_type = 'COMPUTE_CLUSTER'
    and s.seed_oid IN (${DATACENTER})
    and e.last_seen > now()
order by 1
list.label: Cluster
list.name: CLUSTER
list.query:
select distinct
    e.name AS __text,
    e.oid AS __value
from "scope" s 
join entity e on s.scoped_oid = e."oid"
where
    s.scoped_type = 'COMPUTE_CLUSTER'
    and s.seed_oid IN (${DATACENTER})
    and e.last_seen > now()
order by 1

list.definition:
select distinct
    e.name AS __text,
    e.oid AS __value
from "scope" s 
join entity e on s.scoped_oid = e."oid"
where
    s.scoped_type = 'VIRTUAL_MACHINE'

    and e.last_seen > now()

order by 1
list.label: Host List
list.name: HOST_LIST
list.query:
select distinct
    e.name AS __text,
    e.oid AS __value
from "scope" s 
join entity e on s.scoped_oid = e."oid"
where
    s.scoped_type = 'VIRTUAL_MACHINE'

    and e.last_seen > now()

order by 1

list.description: Maximum consumption of your Private Cloud hosts in Watts. You can refer the the "All Published SPECpower_ssh2008 Results" link to get the values for your specific host.
list.label: PUE
list.name: PRIVATE_CLOUD_AVG_PUE

list.description: Private Cloud Emissions Factor corresponds to 1,562.4 lbs CO2/MWh Ã— (4.536 Ã— 10^(-4) metric tons/lb) Ã— 0.001 MWh/kWh = 7.09 Ã— 10^(-4) metric tons CO2/kWh
list.label: Emissions Factor
list.name: PRIVATE_CLOUD_EMISSIONS_FACTOR

list.description: Percent renewable energy used to generate the power that is consumed by your datacenter.
list.label: % Renewable Energy
list.name: PERCENT_RENEWABLE_ENERGY

list.description: Each Tree Seedlings Grown for 10 years captures that amount of ton of CO2
list.name: TREE_SEQUESTRATION_FACTOR

list.description: Each acre of forest captures that amount of ton of CO2 per year
list.name: ACRES_OF_FOREST_SEQUESTRATION_FACTOR

list.description: Emission of ton of CO2 per passenger vehicles driven for 1 year
list.name: VEHICLE_EMISSIONS_FACTOR
